remarks: The property for two points ` A ` and ` B ` to lie on the opposite sides of a set ` D ` Definition 9.1 of [Schwabhauser] p. 67. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 19-Dec-2019.)
statement:
hpg.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
hpg.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
hpg.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
hpg.o $e |- O = { <. a , b >. | ( ( a e. ( P \ D ) /\ b e. ( P \ D ) ) /\ E. t e. D t e. ( a I b ) ) } $.
islnopp.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
islnopp.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
islnopp $p |- ( ph -> ( A O B <-> ( ( -. A e. D /\ -. B e. D ) /\ E. t e. D t e. ( A I B ) ) ) ) $.
$d .- a b t $.
$d A a b t $.
$d B a b t $.
$d D a b t $.
$d G a b t $.
$d I a b t $.
$d O t $.
$d P a b t $.
$d a b ph t $.
